pros: Excellent place to work and feel like part of a team
cons: I have no concerns to mention

pros: -the people who come to the programs are great -good friendships can be formed with coworkers -decent compensation -good supervisors
cons: -managers hold grudges and leave no room for learning -training leaves staff unprepared -no days off policy and when you ask for a day off for a valid reason they give you a hard time -management acts like they are better than everyone else, if you make a mistake they will belittle you -no support, no empathy, no understanding of what staff goes through -work takes a heavy mental and physical toll -unrealistic expectations are set -little to no room for growth -no references given -outdated "values" run by non-disabled people and management does not like when people question or give suggestions about how they can improve their values and bring the company into the modern age -does not seem to care about the opinions of disabled people, it is all about image and a lot of their policies are based on stereotypes and enforcing stigma, they do not consult disabled people and go off of the opinions of non-disabled people

review_title: The co workers are like bunch of high school students.
job_title: Disability Support Worker in Brampton, ON
pros: The only good thing about this organization is that they bear the (Community Living) title in front of their name.
cons: The co workers are like bunch of high school students, they spend most of their time snitching and gossiping on other staff members (especially if the staff is a born male or person of color). They will snap pictures of every fault you make until you get fired. And they will turn back and complain to their manager that they are over worked and short staffed. After getting rid of the masculine energy (born male staff) from the group home. They will not be able to deal with the aggressive residents because they are all bunch of high school students. Like seriously supporting individuals with developmental disabilities is more than just cooking and reading bed time stories for the residents. When there's aggressive behaviors they lock themselves in a room and call 911 even when they're trained in CPI.

pros: Decent pay Can work as much as you'd like
cons: Lots of lifting involved Can be mentally and physically exhausting at times

review_title: Worst organization I have ever worked for
pros: Meaningful work, advocating for people supported and families. Supporting people with disabilities to achieve their goals.
cons: Management and Senior Managements is extremely cruel. Does not care about your personal life, career growth or development. They will literally chew you up and spit you out. As a person who has been working for this organization for 5 years it’s disheartening to explain how they mistreat employees on a daily basis. This is a widely known thing that all employees talk about. Our role is to advocate for others and ensure their goals and overall well being is met, however they do not provide the same treatment to employees. Prepare to be burnt out from the amount of work you have to do with a pay that does not match. I would say run as far as you can from this organization!!!! If I knew what I know now, I would have never pursued a career with this soul sucking organization.
